intro: Cayaponia cogniauxiana, commonly known as the Cayaponia tree, is a tropical plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its fruits are capsules that contain several seeds, and it thrives in humid, warm climates with well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
